answers.answer: Hi I have all your symptoms and then some. I was curious if you have had any blood work done like an Ana
have you thought about Fibromyalgia? go for the test of the Trigger Points? Hope you feel better.

Hi.Well the first thing to do is get a full auto-immune blood profile done, along with a full blood count, and also testing diabetes, and the thyroid.If you have had some blood work done , and you have the results, if you post them , then i will take a look , and advice were to go from next.This could be one off many auto-immune illnesses, so a full bloodwork needs to be done to start ruling out which it can be , from which it obviously is not.Also get ESR, done to check for inflammation.I hope this has helped, and if you need anymore help im here.I know how frustrating it can be when you are suffering, and not accurately diagnosed, so the best thing to do is get tested , so your GP, can refer you on to the right consultant to treat your condition.Good LuckNicola

question: I am 38 years old and I have been suffering from joint pain and fatigue as well as depression and anxiety.  I also have a pain in my chest and feel very unwell.  I cant sleep very well and I feel very tired in the mornings.  I have started to get muscle twitches and numb feet & hands on occasions.  I have been to see my doctor on several occasions and have been diagnosed osteoartheritus in my fingers which can be quite painfull at times.  I also have tinnitus and life is getting quite hard.  I have elevated liver enzymes ast 71, which my doctor can not explain.  I have asked my doctor for an MRI scan but he said he can not justify it at this stage.  I also get blurred vision sometimes.   I have tried various different things to make me feel better but nothing seems to work.    This is affecting my whole life now and I really want to feel better.  Any advice would be greatly appreciated.  Thanks in advance
title: maybe lupus
